channel.title: 317 Models file isn't there. [still need help!]
channel.description: I'm trying to add custom items to a 317 blank source, made by timmah pwnd or something, and theres no models file... where do i put the models?

item.title: 317 Models file isn't there. [still need help!]
item.dc:creator: @excel4 excel4
item.description:
@excel4 wrote:

Oh. I guess I was wrong. Thanks for telling me though! That’s something that I should’ve learned before posting that. xD

Read full topic
item.source: 317 Models file isn't there. [still need help!]

item.title: 317 Models file isn't there. [still need help!]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“excel4, post:4, topic:401233”]What is your client?

There also must be a models folder. If there wasn’t, you wouldn’t have any NPC’s or any items.[/quote]

That isn’t true.

Models are loaded through the cache, which is essentially a compressed pseudo-filesystem.

Clients only have “Model” folders if new models aren’t packed into the cache. Instead, it uses a gzipped file to represent the contents of the model (vertices, textures, colors, etc).

If it’s a blank 317 client, then you’ll have to add external model loading yourself. Or you can use the openRS cachelib developed my blakeman8192 and others. I haven’t looked too much into it myself, but it seems like it should work for something like this.

Read full topic

There also must be a models folder. If there wasn’t, you wouldn’t have any NPC’s or any items.

item.title: 317 Models file isn't there. [still need help!]
item.dc:creator: @excel4 excel4
item.description:
@excel4 wrote:

Go to control panel, and go to folder options. Allow hidden files to be viewed, most clients have their models folder as a hidden file.

- Excel4

Read full topic
